com.percussion.util
Class PSBase64Encoder

java.lang.Object
  com.percussion.util.PSBase64Encoder

public class PSBase64Encoder
extends Object

The PSBase64Encoder class is used to encode data from the base64 format. It is a wrapper for the Apache Commons Base64 codec.

Base64 Encoding is defined in RFC 1521.

Since:
1.0
Version:
1.0
Author:
Tas Giakouminakis

Constructor Detail

PSBase64Encoder

public PSBase64Encoder()
Method Detail

main

public static void main(String[] args)
This allows the encoder to be run stand-alone. The sole argument should be the text to encode.

Parameters:
args - an array of arguments passed in. All provided strings will be base64 encoded and then printed to the console.

encode

public static String encode(String in)
                     throws com.percussion.error.PSRuntimeException
Encodes the specified string using the base64 algorithm.

Parameters:
in - the string containing the plain text representation of the data, never null
Returns:
a string containing the base64 encoded data, never null
Throws:
com.percussion.error.PSRuntimeException - if anything goes wrong while encoding the provided string.

encode

public static String encode(String in,
                            String encoding)
                     throws com.percussion.error.PSRuntimeException
Encodes the specified string using the base64 algorithm.

Parameters:
in - the string containing the plain text representation of the data
encoding - the encoding string to use for retrieving the string to be encoded. if null, the platform's default charater set is used.
Returns:
a string containing the base64 encoded data, never null
Throws:
com.percussion.error.PSRuntimeException - if the specified encoding is not supported

encode

public static long encode(InputStream in,
                          OutputStream out)
                   throws IOException
Encodes binary data from the specified input stream using the base64 algorithm, writing the encoded data to the specified output stream.

Parameters:
in - the stream containing the plain text representation of the data, never null.
out - the stream to store the base64 encoded data, never null.
Returns:
The number of bytes encoded.
Throws:
IOException - if an I/O exception occurs

encode

public static byte[] encode(byte[] in)
Encodes binary data using the base64 algorithm and chunks the encoded output into 76 character blocks.

Parameters:
in - byte data to be encoded, never null
Returns:
Base64 characters chunked in 76 character blocks
